name: Chelsea Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Enjoyed my stay in this pretty converted brownstone very much. Wonderful location in a quiet Chelsea neighborhood, just a few steps away from plenty of restaurants and shopping. I was very pleasantly surprised given the low price and recommend it highly to anyone looking for a nice budget hotel in Manhattan. Closest subway station is a little over a block away. Staff was friendly and helpful. The entire hotel looks recently renovated. The room was tiny, but it was clean, quiet and - most importantly, had a private shower and sink, which is hard to find in this price range for this type of hotel. The TV didn't work very well but I didn't expect a tv in the first place so it wasn't a big deal. Window opened up to a fire escape overlooking residential courtyard. Each floor has two communal toilets, which were freshly decorated in black and white tile and always immaculate. And each night a hershey's kiss on the pillow was a nice touch. Recommended!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, excellent value and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Chelsea Lodge. Really pleased with our choice of accommodation.
reviews.title: Great value, great location
great value for money
reviews.text: The room was a good size, with a comfortable bed and plenty of storage. The shared toilet was next door, and like the rooms, was kept very clean. The building has a nice feel about it and the staff we met were really helpful and friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was great, just minutes from Times Square. It was good to explore Chelsea and we found lots of great, trendy bars and restaurants in the nearby area. Can highly recommend the nearby Dish for a hearty breakfast!
reviews.title: Loved it!

likes.disliked: — Shower in room made it very humid...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 5 of us stayed here when visitng NY for the first time in December. The hotel is great value for money and a brilliant location as it is close to the main tourist areas, but also to Greenwich Village and Soho. In terms of what we wanted it for (comfortable place to sleep, clean, good location), it was spot on. We came with a wheelchair (it is up 4 steps so not perfect) and they gave us a room on the ground floor and somewhere to store the chair, as well as being very patient storing the extra bags we had to buy at the end of the week to try and fit everything in!!
reviews.title: Did not love the Chealsea Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed @ the Chelsea Lodge and Loved it! We read about it on trip advisor and contacted them ourselves by phone. The rooms are small but very clean and quiet! You have a private shower and sink in your room, but you share the toilets in the hallway, which are also very clean. We only used the toilets in the morning and evening, since we were gone all day sightseeing, so it wasn't a problem at all. The air conditioners worked great and we had maid service each morning. The staff was friendly and they allow you to use their computor to print your boarding passes which was a big relief! (there is free WiFi in your room)
reviews.title: Loved The Chelsea Lodge

likes.liked: — Quiet location, centrally located, easy access to subway, eating and shopping close by

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: I'd recommend staying there to anyone I know and would definately stay there again myself!(if I ever can get my husband to return to the big apple) We had an awesome time and found New Yorkers to be very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.disliked: — Lack of fridge and safe in room

reviews.title: Great Place to stay.
reviews.text: Thank you,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: Lori Higgins
reviews.title: Loved it - just like nearly everyone else

likes.liked: — above average for budget accomodation, nicely decorated
likes.disliked: — in a slightly quieter part of Manhatten - I'd be careful at night (probably pretty obvious anyway)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Given Bubbavon's very comprehensive review - there isn't really much to say! Only that I echo his/ her comments.
reviews.title: Great when the heat is on

likes.disliked: — The keys are worn and difficult to use

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: Our family of four has been ALL over, and we've stayed in every kind of lodging -- from five star hotels to very personal, homey B&Bs -- and each one of us loved our time at the Chelsea Lodge.
reviews.title: Charming Chelsea Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the larger units, a Parlor Suite, and were surprised and delighted at the level of decoration and attention to detail for such a very inexpensive stay. This may be budget accommodation in price, but not in style, and certainly not in cleanliness! I only wish my own home would be so sparkling all the time!
reviews.title: Good price, good location.
Great Hotel
reviews.text: Our 13 year-old daughter slept on the spacious futon in the living area, while a separate cot (also quite comfortable) was brought in for our 9 year-old.

reviews.title: Certainly lived up to the good reviews!
reviews.text: The kitchenette was well-appointed and very useful for storing snack items, and the marble bathroom has a great shower.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006
reviews.text: The location, in the heart of lovely Chelsea, is another big plus for this place; it's a little oasis of green and quiet to come 'home' to after a busy day in the City.
reviews.title: Best Deal Around!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Chelsea Lodge from 21-25 October.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived by yellow medallion taxi from JFK airport (cost around $55 including tolls & tip). The taxi stand is just across the road outside the airport exit and even though there was a queue it is patrolled by a warden so it moves very efficiently.
reviews.title: Chelseas Secret

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You will be hassled on leaving the airport to take a private cab/limo to Manhattan, however, we were warned about this as the driver's are not always insured. A firm "no thanks" was all that was needed to let them know you are not interested.
reviews.title: Worked well for seniors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It helps to have a note of the lodge address on a piece of paper just to hand to the taxi driver so that you end up at the right place! The taxi journey took around 40 minutes...be prepared for some mad driving though!
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lodge reception was lovely and welcoming and the man on reception was warm and friendly he helped us with our cases to our room.
reviews.title: Wonderful Chelsea Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: We stayed for six nights at this perfect small brownstone hotel; we wanted to experience the real New York. We found Chelsea to be a safe, quite neighbourhood. Chelsea Lodge is spotlessly clean, all rooms having a daily maid service when towels are changed every day. The rooms are cosy and small with a good shower, washhand basin, TV, ceiling fan and alarm clock, the restroom is down the hall but also spotlessly clean. The staff when encountered are friendly and helpful. The hotel is close to 23rd Street subway; we arrived from JFK via an easy journey on the airtrain and subway from Howards Beach.
reviews.title: Go stay at the Chelsea Lodge, great location for your trip to Manhatten

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: For breakfast can also recommend the New Venus Diner on 8th Avenue between 22nd/23rd Street where staff are friendly and attentive.
reviews.title: Little Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: For evening meals we can recommend Patsy's Pizzeria at 318 West 23rd Street which has an excellent family friendly atmosphere.
reviews.title: Excellent
Excellent place to stay!
reviews.text: We had a great stay in New York and can thoroughly recommend the Chelsea Lodge.

reviews.title: Lovely place
reviews.text: Excellent value for money. Staff were helpful, the rooms were very clean and the shower was great - constant hot water.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here for 8 nights. I read a lot of reviews before we booked so was prepared for the small rooms, communal toilets etc. In fact it was a pleasant surprise when we arrived as our room was bigger than expected. Staff were really cool and helpful and the room was always spotlessly clean when we returned to the hotel each day. And of course you can't beat the location.
reviews.title: Fantastic price, fantastic location, but they need new beds!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just a couple of minor things that could easily be improved, our bed was possibly the worst I have ever slept in. It dipped in the middle and as the frame was on castors the whole bed would move if you/or your partner moved around in the night. It was only for the fact that we were absloutely exhausted from sightseeing that we got some sleep!
reviews.title: Loation Locaton Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Also they loan hairdryers and irons which is great. But it would be even better if the irons worked!
reviews.title: It is great: please stay away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006
reviews.text: But I really liked this place so despite these minor points I would still recommend it!
reviews.title: Great stay overall, but some caveats

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Having visited new york twice before we(byf) wanted to stay some away form Midtown and the madness!! This is the most unusual hotel/guest house we have stayed in.not at all what you would expect in manhattan.It was clean, cheap and perfect for us. Our room was 2H on the first floor and was bigger than i had expected after reading the reviews and seeing some pics. Found the staff were friendly. Chelsea is a great place to stay, always felt safe, lots of bars and restaurants..try la lasagna on 8th ave,corner of 20th, great food and a really good atmosphere. All locals, think we were only tourists there.you have to have one of there Martinis! i wouldnt hesitate in recommending chelsea Lodge to anyone visiting new york especially if you would like to get e feel for the city ands its locals. i loved it.
reviews.title: Superb Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: This is a great place to stay. We stayed here for 3 nights. The rooms were small but sparkling clean. The shared toilet was also always clean and we virtually never had to wait to use it. It is also in a really good location with plenty or reasonably priced restaurants nearby and also two subway stations within a short walk. We didn't find the staff to be friendly at all though actually (unlike previous reviewers). They weren't exactly rude but bordered on it with their "bare minimum" responses to our questions. But overall, compared with prices of other lodgings in NYC, I would say Chelsea Lodge is excellent value.
reviews.title: Pleasant Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Chelsea Lodge for the 4th of July weekend. When I booked, I was not able to get the Upper Garden Suite for the entire stay, so the first night we stayed in one of the Deluxe Rooms (the only difference from the regular rooms is that it has its own bathroom). The Deluxe room was very clean, but too small for our liking.
reviews.title: Upper Garden Suite- The only way to go

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: However, we cannot say enough positive things about the Upper Garden Suite. This suite makes you feel like you live in New York. It was an apartment that is now being used as a hotel room. The ceilings are high and the layout is cute. Also, there are no markings on the door so you don't get that hotel feel at all, which I truly enjoyed.
reviews.title: like living in the city
Lovely hotel
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is superb, it is only three blocks from the closest subway (8th Ave. and 23rd St.). Some of the best restuarants are also in Chelsea. For breakfast try Murray's Bagels on 8th Ave. and for lunch or dinner try the "Rocking Horse" (mexican cuisine) or "Spice" (thai cuisine). We absolutely loved the food at "Spice" and the wait service is excellent.

reviews.title: Chelsea Lodge - A Gem within the Big City
reviews.text: When we visit New York again, we will definitely stay in the upper garden suite at this charming hotel in Chelsea.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 5 nights from 13th November. We had a lovely cosy room behind reception which was so quiet at night (we had taken ear plugs expecting to need them but didn’t!). We loved the location and the personal touches in this hotel. The staff were lovely and the rooms/ toilets very clean, warm and homely. we hardly ever saw another guest. Shared toilets no problem at all. The rooms are compact, but what do you need more space in a room for? We looked forward to coming "home" to our sanctuary after each busy day in the city. The Lodge is close to great restaurants and amenities! Can't fault it– We would gladly come back.
reviews.title: Wow, what a haven from the hustle and bustle!

likes.liked: — The "smallness" and cosiness - it felt like coming home each day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is clean and in a good location, it feels safe and the shared toilets work just fine. The staff are helpful and given the price you cant complain that the room is small (it saves you a small fortune when compared to the price of a hotel). It was perfect for our trip, we spent our money enjoying new york rather than on a fancy room. Would deffo come back.
reviews.title: great place excellent value for money

likes.liked: — price and the short distance from Penn Station
likes.disliked: — the radiator made a noise at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I live in New York (long island) and my husband and I wanted to stay in the city for labor day week end. We didnt want to spend to much, and I found this lovely hotel and also the price was very reasonable. The room was small.but considering that we wouldnt spend the week end in our room. ..it was perfect, very clean, and the staff was very nice. I would recommend this hotel. Also the emplacement was perfect, near by everything . We had a wonderfull stay!
reviews.title: Loved it!!

likes.disliked: — the shared bathroom, but it was very clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Excellent value place in Chelsea. Rooms are small and WC is shared but everything is spotlessly clean, staff are really friendly and for less than $150 in a great location, you can't go wrong.
reviews.title: Great little place - excellent value for New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008
reviews.text: We stayed at the Chelsea Lodge for 5 days from 25th October 2008.
reviews.title: New York's little secret

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Chelsea Suites is an awesome place to stay. It is in a great neighborhood close to many great shops and restaurants. The bus and subway is super close. I stayed in the parlor suite closest to the street. The only drawback is the street noise. I would recommend a suite off of the street for the best experience. I can not wait to go back. This is where I will stay in New York from here on out.
reviews.title: Chelsea Suites is the place to be

likes.disliked: — Street noise (not really that bad though)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in late April/ early May, in one of the ordinary rooms on the 1st floor. We got married in Central Park May 1st so part of the stay was our honeymoon. Alltogether we stayed for 7 nights and could easily stayed longer.
reviews.title: A peaceful room in buzzing city

likes.liked: — it was a classic brownstone building!
likes.disliked: — all surrounding restaurants and shops were a bit more pricy than on the upper west side

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a small room with a queen sized bed, an open closet, a drawer, a small TV, a wash basin and a shower. The window faced the back garden. All the rooms (5 I think) on one floor shared two toilets which were perfectly cleaned all the time, and so was our room. The towels were changed every day if you threw them on the floor, and shampoo and soap were provided when needed. No hair dryer, but I bought one for 25 dollars at the drugstore on the corner (a traveling model that can be used on 110 and 220 V).
reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The style of the interior design was old American country classic and very suitable for this classic brownstone buildning. The street was calm and quiet, and the neighborhood contained of people from all walks of life and had a lot of good breakfast lunch, coffee, dinner and bar choices. Also, you have movie theatres, some shops and the riverside walk with all sorts of sporting activities. And several subway and bus lines close by.
reviews.title: A little gem in the Big Apple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff was very quick and helpful with luggage, answering questions and leaving messages when someone phoned us.
reviews.title: Highly recommeded

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: If you are wanting a basic room at a budget NYC price then the Chelsea Lodge is ideal. Included is a tv with cable channels, washbasin and shower cubicle...just what I needed considering I was only there to sleep, relax a little and wash!! The toilets down the hall were always clean and available !!
reviews.title: Thoroughly recommend!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and welcoming. The area felt incredibly safe and neighbourly!! I could live in Chelsea permanently!!
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Conveniently located - between Midtown and the Financial District.
reviews.title: Great little hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are plenty of shops, bars and cafes to choose from and a cinema.
reviews.title: Loved the Chelsea -- will definately stay there next time we are in NYC

likes.liked: — The feeling that you were living in a real life pocket of NYC
likes.disliked: — no washing machine/dryer (from our knowledge anyway)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Subway conveniently close by and if you dont mind walking, it really isn't that far to the Theatre District and other famous sites!
reviews.title: Super fantastic budget hotel in excellent location!

likes.liked: — The location, very clean and comfortable.
likes.disliked: — Rooms are a little on the small side and sharing toilets, but for the price, definately acceptable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the perfect budget hotel for a short stay but if you are staying longer than 4 days then you may want to look for a place with a few more facilities.
reviews.title: Great value for a short stay

likes.disliked: — Too basic for a longer stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly staff and the room was exactly what we expected. Basic but clean and tidy. We stayed for 3 nights (4 days) and found by the end that we missed having more room facilities and a bar/lounge to collapse in at the end of the day after sightseeing before heading our for the evening.
reviews.title: Lovely

likes.liked: — I loved that I felt like I was home, while in my room, which was 2F, I left my door open while hanging out, because it was so quiet and no one was there to bother me
likes.disliked: — The room getting steamy, only because I just straightened my hair and didn't want it to frizz! It didnt bother my boyfriend at all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price this has a great location and does exactly what you would expect - a place to sleep at the end of a busy day. The local bars & restaurants are also excellent value for money.
reviews.title: Great place to enjoy NYC and still relax
don't stay there ...
reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful. I came here with my boyfriend a few days before Christmas. We stayed here two nights and had a great experience. I am surprised no one has written about how charming the lobby is. I felt like I own a little brownstone in the city. Our room although small was exceptionally clean as was the shower stall in the room. I saw the cleaning ladies each day and the place smelled of pinesol, which I love because it makes me feel clean. :) The people at the desk were all very pleasant and it was a very quiet place. Yes, you share a bathroom, but it is also very clean and well maintained. If I have to list some of the cons, the only ones are that the room did feel a TINY bit muggy for me after my shower, but my boyfriend says that was just me, he didnt notice it. The second thing was our neighbors were quiet loud in the morning, it seemed they opened and closed their door about 50 times. The Chelsea Lodge itself is incredibly clean, pleasant staff, great location, its across the street from an elementary school; and the room was a perfect size. If you have any questions, please feel free to email me at tatumshirin@yahoo.com about it! I wil absolutely stay here again if I am in NYC again.

reviews.title: Chelsea Lodge - Perfect!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Lodge the first week of December. Our experience was great. We stayed in room 2E. It was cleaned everyday, fresh towels and everything tied up. Small room but enough for the time we spent in, wich was almost just to sleep. The different persons we met at the front desk from the time we arrived were very polite and helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: I found the Chelsea Lodge using TripAdvisor. TripAvisor has earned its keep with this one!
reviews.title: Absolutely great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: $109/night in Manhattan - can't beat the price. It was probably the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in - for any price.
reviews.title: Adored the Chelsea Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms have their own sink and shower, but you have to use the shared bathrooms. All the above are exceptionally clean. I have definitely paid more for a dirtier, but private, bathroom. Don't let this scare you off - the Chelsea Lodge is a great place.
reviews.title: Same as last time, super place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only time for a brief review, but felt I had to add to the positive reviews on this site.
reviews.title: Great budget hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed in the Chelsea Lodge for 6 nights in December, and was bowled over by it's charm. The rooms are small but perfectly acceptable - I've had smaller rooms in London - and as other reviewers have confirmed, spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: as if you lived your dream in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in the Chelsea Lodge for 4 nights in November 2006. Great little budget hotel, its like living as a New Yorker. Looks just like an ordinary brownstone from the outside so make sure you've got good directions if taking a cab to it.
reviews.title: Little Gem in New York

likes.liked: — Central located, Budget rates, Free wireless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Felt safe in the area, there is a police station a few streets up and surrounded by eateries and good bars, you're never short of a place to eat or drink. Recommend the Dallas BBQ and the Galaxy Diner for eats, Flight 151 bar for drinks. Subway close by and within reasonable walking to Madison Square Garden / Times Square / Midtown area.
reviews.title: A great find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms pretty compact but they have good showers and TV's. Decor a bit weird (lots of ducks and Red Indian heads) but not offensive! Shared bathrooms not an issue, they were never both in use and always spotless. Didn't have any probs with the desk staff, always polite and helpful. Would certainly stay again.
reviews.title: Great New York stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friend & I have just returned from a long weekend staying in the lower garden suite - it was fantastic! Big room, huge bathroom, well-equipped kitchen and lovely patio & garden. We even woke to the sound of birds singing - hard to believe in the middle of New York! Chelsea is a safe & friendly neighbourhood - great for escaping the hustle & bustle but still convenient for visiting the major sights. There's a handy pharmacy at the end of the street and a Starbucks just around the corner - along with a number of great restaurants and cocktail bars! For night owls, the Meatpacking District is a cheap cab fare/easy stroll - the Spice Market, Buddah Bar and Pastis are all worth a visit.
reviews.title: Feel like a New Yorker !

likes.liked: — It was so quirky and individual, it felt like renting a funky apartment for a week
likes.disliked: — bed could be a bit more comfy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have previously stayed in one of the lodge rooms and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again - it's great value for money.
reviews.title: Exactly what I expected: a good thing!
Small in space = small in rates!
reviews.text: If you're looking to enjoy New York and just want a clean place to lay your head and shower for a good price then the Chelsea Lodge is your place. Located in a great central location you could not ask for a better hotel. Rooms are neat and clean, clean towels provided daily, walking distance from everything you want to see. Just wantch the parking if you rent a car.... NY parking police love to tow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got to agreed with all the previous review. We stayed during the week of July 4 and it's so great to go back to a quiet neighbourhood after visiting all the busy tourist spots.
reviews.title: Charming hotel, nice neighbourhood but small room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Besides the thin wall, another reminder is there are 3 floors and they do not have a lift. Also, if you are bringing a large luggauge, you might find it difficult to open it in the room.
reviews.title: Met our expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: Despite the above, we will still consider staying here again.
reviews.title: Clean and Cute, bit unfriendly though!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: This hotel certainly lived up to our expectations and the other tripadvisor reviews. The hotel is located in Chelsea, in a charming residential, quiet street between 8th and 9th Avenue where you can find great places to eat and hang out as well as go out at night. The hotel as such as lovingly decorated. Our room was very much on the small side with a rather small bed, but the air conditioning was working fine, and for the small price we paid, we didnt exactly expect a palatial room in the first place! Showers and toilets were immaculately clean, our room was cleaned every morning and fresh towels provided. Our room was very sweet and the decoration so charming that size really didn't matter at all. The room also came with free wireless internet which was fantastic. The only thing I could criticise were the thin walls, meaning you could suffer if you had noisy neighbours, and the slightly unfriendly man that greeted us! The night porter was lovely, friendly and really sweet. The other guy was sort of grumpy and quiet and made me feel unwelcome. But then - who cares when you're in New York! I would definately stay here again. It's a bargain for what it is so don't tell anyone about this place. Let's keep it a secret!
reviews.title: Lived up to Tripadvisor reviews and my expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my then boyfriend in October 2006 for five days and we both loved it. For the price you couldn't moan about this place at all. At first I was a bit worried about the room size, using a toilet outside the room, but when we got to our room we were very relieved! Room was on the first floor so only one flight of stairs and it was tucked in the left hand side corner, either room 7 or 8, i cant remember. anyhow we overlooked the street, we did hear a bit of noice at night but nothing that kept us awake. The room itself was really cute, the bed was actually bigger than i first thought (I thought it would be a tiny double bed but it was fine) and the shower worked great, there was just enough space for our luggage, one case, under the bed, and one on the luggage rack.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in NYC ona budget

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006
reviews.text: As for the location it was perfect. The area was great, the street was so pretty, reminded me of Carrie Bradshaws apartment in Sex and the City, so I felt like a real New Yorker staying there! Went to eat at the diner across the road, believe its been mentioned here before, but we much prefered the Empire diner, turn left out of the hotel, and walk a couple of blocks, and you will find it, its a great 50's style diner, breakfast is great and its v popular.
reviews.title: Excellent - lovely neighbourhood - great apartment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Have been to New York before and much prefered this location, its a 10 minute walk to Greenwich Village and a 20 minute walk to the Empire State so a great place to be. Plus I loved the vibe of being in Chelsea, not so mad as the touristy part of NYC.
reviews.title: Birdsong in New York!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Would definatly stay again if on a budget, really nice guys who own it, felt very safe. Oh and the toilets are so clean, so that was great! : )
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice surprise. We stayed in the "suites" rather than the lodge. We had a parlour suite - the very front basement room facing the street. It's like staying in a nice apartment rather than in a hotel. Why pay hotel prices when you can have the privacy of a comfortable apartment ! What a great comfortable apartment and a wonderful location. Close to shops and metro stations.
reviews.title: A great find !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I chose the Chelsea Lodge after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. It' s in a great location, convenient for uptown and downtown with a subway stop close by. I would recommend the second floor garden suite over the basement one, it was much better laid out and brighter. Overall it's great value for money.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My one problem was the quality of cleaning service; we stayed 6 nights and not once was the floor vacuumed, the beds were not made properly and the linen didn't appear to be changed at all.
reviews.title: Felt like home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Along with the majority of people on here, we discovered the Chelsea Lodge by searching through the recommended hotels in New York City on Tripadvisor and wondered why a small privately owned hotel, which seemed so cheap, was amongst some of the best reviewed hotels in Manhattan.
reviews.title: Stay here!!! Remove all fear of the unknown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading through the many reviews we decided to contact the hotel directly and ask if they had the basement room available. Whilst researching the hotel we found out that the basement rooms were larger than the normal compact rooms and they are also en-suite whereas the other rooms have to share the bathrooms. The hotel mentioned that they cost a little extra but we worked it out to be around £10 more than a standard room. For additional space and en-suite, we thought this was worth it.
reviews.title: Absolutely great place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is situated in the Chelsea which is a neighbourhood on the West Side of the New York City borough of Manhattan. The hotel is located a couple of blocks from 23rd Street Subway. There is no sign on the hotel to indicate that it's the Chelsea Lodge so make sure you take note of the street and the number of the building otherwise you could quite easily walk past it without realising. The hotel is a two minute walk to many shops, deli's, bars and restaurants and has pretty much everything you would need within 5 minutes of the hotel. I recommend the 'Lasagna Ristorante' as a really nice place to eat. It's located on the corner of 8th Avenue, 20th Street.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay!!

likes.liked: — The location, cleanliness, and fantastic price!
likes.disliked: — The bed, pillows. and lack of internet access (unless bringing your own computer).

description: Chelsea Lodge is located in the heart of the historic Chelsea district in New York City.Our 22-guest room European-style hotel is conveniently located to all of New York City, but still gives a sense of being away from it all. The secure, private, and quiet Chelsea Lodge provides a clean and comfortable environment at reasonable rates for our guests.
